alert.note: Alert for Wilson; Woodson (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 31 at 11:09PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Wilson and Woodson Counties through 1145 PM CDT... At 1109 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 5 miles southwest of Yates Center to 5 miles west of Buffalo to 5 miles north of Fredonia. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fredonia, Yates Center, Altoona, Toronto, Buffalo, Benedict, New Albany, Coyville, Cross Timbers State Park, Toronto Lake, Batesville and Rose. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM CDT for southeastern Kansas.
